body.name: Can't Stop What's Inside: A Female Vigilante Psychological Crime Thriller Novel (The Madison Sanders Trilogy)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35

body.description: Madison has returned. The notorious female anti-hero that readers hate to love. Book 2 of the Madison Sanders Trilogy, "Can't Stop What's Inside," follows Madison's journey as she tries to move forward and pursue her dreams while confronting her past murders. Along the way, she unexpectedly falls in love and looks forward to a promising future.But her life is suddenly disrupted by events beyond her control, causing her to struggle with her sanity and the dangers of her psychotic mania, while ghosts from the past return to haunt her.When things seem hopeless, karma knocks on her door with a death warrant. Her fate is sealed. Or is it?Remember—this is Madison Sanders.Karma may stand in her way—But it can't stop what's inside. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just plain MADison!
reviews.reviewText: And the story continues…CAN’T STOP WHAT’S INSIDE is the second in the Madison Sanders trilogy by C. J. Heigelmann and it’s just as good as the first one.We find Madison moving on with her life after the events in book 1; she is working at an animal shelter and enjoying her life behind the lens. She still has best friend, Brittany close by who encourages her to get out in the world and maybe date a little. It just so happens that she ends up with one of the detectives who investigated the case that led to the death of her precious son.As Madison and Alex get closer, he starts to wonder about the integrity of some of the guys he works with. Oh, and all the while there is a madman/serial killer who’s been sent by the family to track her down. He kills people to get what he wants along the way. The killer is actually her cousin, Max Himmel. As Max gets closer, so do the Seattle cops that are chasing HIM.I really like this author and was happy to see that it was a trilogy. We get a chance to delve deeper into the characters. I’m not sure whether I’d want to have a cuppa with ANYONE except Brittany. She seems like the only normal one out of the whole lot!I am really looking forward to book 3 to see how it all ends up. Unfortunately, I THINK I know where some of it might be going, but I really hope I’m wrong.Thank you to BookSirens and Common Folk Press Publishing for this ARC opportunity. All opinions are my own and given voluntarily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What can I say bad about Madison?
reviews.reviewText: Thank you C.J for this second GOODREAD of Madison and yes, Brittany. This book caught my attention within 10 pages of reading. I don't know if I like Madison for the way she sets up to kill, or she's just your average neighbor that you don't know whats really going on in her head. This book keeps you on your toes for sure. Waiting for the 3rd go-around of this series..Thank You

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Who is the Real Victim?
reviews.reviewText: Great follow up to the first book in the series, Can’t Hide What’s inside. Though not necessary, I would suggest reading the first in order to get all the background info. In this story, Madison is able to move on from the death of her boy, and even falls in love. But it seems that disaster is meant to follow her where ever she goes. She is hit with information that spins her world out of control.This book was more condensed then the previous, making the reading more enjoyable. Twists and turns make you wonder who is the victim. The author again takes on hard subjects, so if you are mild of heart, be warned. Looking forward to the next in the series. Thanks to BookSiren for the ARC of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Who’s the victim in this thriller?
reviews.reviewText: Thrilling second-in-series sequel! Just enough twists, at the right moment, to keep you turning the pages. I’m a Madison Sanders fan but with each chapter I kept asking, “who’s the victim in this thriller?” Looking forward to the final book of this trilogy to maybe answer my question. Definitely a Good Read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Madison is Back
reviews.reviewText: This is the 2nd book in Madison’s trilogy and a lot was going on. She met one of the policemen that was involved in her earlier case by chance and according to both of them they are made for each other after getting to know one another. Then you have Ricci who is Shultz’ partner which starts to go south after they do a call together. Shultz goes to his Olson who is his captain to talk to him about what went down. This is when the book gets really exciting because there is something going on between Ricci and Olson. There are many twists in this story and of Madison is the key player with all the characters in the book. I was going to give the book a 3 or 3.5 star rating but I pushed it up to 4 since I really didn’t see the ending coming.I would like to thank C.J. for the ARC.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very exciting and always a twist pulling you into the book.
reviews.reviewText: Enjoyed the 1st and also the 2nd book. Would highly recommend reading the 1st book before starting the 2nd. Now I can’t wait for the 3rd book.CJ Heigelmann never disappoints

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Must read if you like suspense!
reviews.reviewText: Hair raising and breathtaking and suspenseful…hold on to your britches, it’s gonna be a bumpy ride. Oh how I’ve missed Ms. Madison! This is book two in a series. The author did an outstanding job bridging the two books. He went in to enough “refresher” to pick up where book one left off without making it a complete rewrite of the first book. He, like in book one, makes this story relevant in todays world. So many of societies issues are touched upon in the this series, and you don’t realize it was brought out. This is because it is all told in a voice of love and stability and not judgement. Speaking of stability, Madison has deep rooted, nature vs nurture issues with mental health. She knows right from wrong…her natural tendencies lean toward wrong, but she works hard to live right. Best book I’ve read in a while and very pleased it’s a series.
